constructor.details: Initializes the BridgingPayment contract with the ERC20Manager address, fee amount, and initial owner.

params._erc20Manager: The address of the ERC20Manager contract that will handle bridging requests.
params._fee: The initial fee amount required for bridging.
params.initialOwner: The address that will receive the bridging fees.

erc20Manager().details: Returns the address of the ERC20Manager.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

payFee().details: Pays the fee to the contract owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

documentation.text: @dev Returns the address of the ERC20Manager.
@dev Modifier to check if the caller is the ERC20Manager.

@dev Sets the fee amount.
 @param _fee The new fee amount.
@dev Pays the fee to the contract owner.

@dev BridgingPayment smart contract is responsible for collecting bridging fees
      for transferring tokens from Ethereum to Vara. This smart contract enables
      setting fee amount, updating owner address that will collect the fee, and
      setting `ERC20Manager` smart contract that will handle bridging requests.
